case_title: ZIKRIYA vs ASSISTANT COMMISSIONER, PISHIN AND 2 OTHERS

legal_basis.challenged_provision: Section 17 of the Criminal Law (Special Provisions) Ordinance, 1968

facts.allegations: Helping a proclaimed offender (Bismillah) evade arrest, causing potential danger to public tranquility
facts.security_demand: Rs. 50,000 with two sureties for three years
facts.detention: Nasrullah was detained in sub-Jail, Pishin, after refusing to furnish security.

legal_arguments.petitioner: The allegations do not fall under Section 17 of the Ordinance, making the detention unlawful.
legal_arguments.respondents: The allegations justify action under Section 17, and the petition is premature as inquiry was pending.

court_findings.notice_validity: The notice did not meet the requirements of Section 17 of the Ordinance.
court_findings.detention_legality: Nasrullah's detention was declared unlawful as the notice lacked legal authority.

precedents_cited.relevance: Action under similar provisions requires allegations of murder or culpable homicide.

precedents_cited.case_name: Raja Haq Nawaz v. Mohummad Afzal and others
Murree Brewery Company Limited v. Pakistan
precedents_cited.relevance: Jurisdictional defects in notices justify writ petitions.

court_decision.notice_status: Declared without lawful authority and of no legal effect.
